Mint Stamp: The mint stamp on this Cover was issued
On opening day, September 23, Earle L. Ovington
was sworn in as America's first aeroplane mail carrier.
He climbed into his tiny Bleriot plane, tucking the
mail bag crammed with some 1,900 cards and letters
between his legs. Taking off,
he flew to Mineola,
three miles away, where waiting postal officials
by Lesotho in 1983 to commemorate the bicentennial
of manned flight. It shows a crowd of onlookers
watching the first airmail flight.
Postmark: This Cover was postmarked in Garden City,
New York on September 23, 1984, the exact anniver-
sary of America's first experimental airmail flight.

properties.sfomuseum:description: Airmail flight cover, part of International Tributes to the History of Flight series by the Postal Commemorative Society; white envelope with full color illustration cachet and inset stamp commemorating America’s first experimental airmail flight on September 23, 1911, in Garden City, New York, U.S.A., by Earle L. Ovington with Bleriot “Dragonfly” airplane; cancellation stamp dated September 23, 1984 in Garden City; includes information on reverse.
